page.title: 15Education in S.E. Guildford
page.content:
Shalford School, Pewley Down School and Chilworth C. of E. School are first schools catering for ages five to eight. Subjects include reading, writing, and basic skills such as table manners and tying shoe laces. Each school has both girls and boys. They start at 9.00 a.m. and finish at 3.00 p.m. Chilworth School has no set uniform but the others have.
Tillingbourne Middle School caters for eight to twelve year olds in Chilworth and has 230 pupils. Two school buses bring children from surrounding areas which include Peaslake and Cranleigh.
There is an Adult Education Centre providing day and evening classes in many subjects including computing, classics and modern languages. Pupils' ages range from 16 to 80.
